intro: Trixis sellowii, commonly known as the Sellow's trixis, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are usually narrow and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. Trixis sellowii is often found in grasslands and shrublands, contributing to the biodiversity of its native habitat.
